p: In this study, P. guajava showing activity against P. aeruginosa confirms the observation by Abdelrahim et al. [ 55], who indicated that, in their study, all clinical isolates tested including that of P. aeruginosa were sensitive to extracts of P. guajava [ 55]. This observation confirms the traditional uses of this plant [ 56], which is also available in most parts of the study location (Ghana). According to Lins et al. [ 56], P. guajava has numerous properties including antioxidant, anti-allergic, anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial. This is likely the reason for which this plant and others investigated in the current study are widely used in traditional medicine for wound healing [ 4].
